intro: Iresine rzedowskii, commonly known as the red-veined strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with red veins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Iresine rzedowskii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage.
